website_summaries.verdict: This potato masher provides more surface area  for more efficient mashing of potatoes, avocados, eggs, and other foods. We like the integrated silicone bowl scraper, too.
pros: Large circular blade resists bending under pressure
Handle fits hand well, requires little pressure
Creates a uniform mashing size, no lumps or chunks
cons: Too big to fit in a standard kitchen drawer
Some rusting and corrosion can happen over time

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only a month's usage
customer_reviews.text: Like it well enough and hand washed it to be sure that it lasted, then when using it today after only using it several times, the metal came disconnected from the handle and it is no longer usable. VERY POORLY MADE. Unfortunately, it's just past a month so I can't return it. DON'T BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Top quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the quality of this tool for the price! It has no grooves or seams to trap food so it is super easy to clean and very sanitary. One feature I missed in the description that is very useful is the integrated spatula on one side -- makes it easy to clean the sides of the bowl and direct contents back to the bottom as you go. I have rheumatoid arthritis in my hands and one of reasons I chose this particular masher was the handle. It has proven to be every bit as easy to hold on to as I had hoped. Just the right diameter and cushioned to improve grip and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: jessamine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Saw this product on America's Test Kitchen show and it got the best rating for making mashed potatoes manually. I tried it and could not be more pleased with the quality and design. Just make sure you don't use a coated pot because the metal will mark the coating. However, the mashed potatoes came out superb!!
customer_reviews.author: Janete

customer_reviews.title: A Great Masher!
customer_reviews.text: Don't write a lot of reviews and especially about kitchen tools but this is an exception. I have been making mashed potatoes for many many years. I have used other manual mashers and electric mixers. This Zyliss unit is--for me--the best of the best. I have a unit somewhat similar to the Zyliss but the Zyliss is superior--especially in how it handles in one's hand during actual use. Anyway, it is a great unit at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gaston "watch guy"

customer_reviews.title: Best masher EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: Is it nuts to LOVE a potato masher? I'm not kidding, this thing is a revelation! It works really REALLY well. I used to struggle (& curse) while using my old grocery aisle version. When I read the glowing reviews I tried this masher and what a huge difference. There's almost no effort required. I'm using it for all kinds of mashing...bananas for banana bread, parsnips, cauliflower...works like a charm. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DeborahDarlingTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: You need this.
customer_reviews.text: I can speak only for myself, of course, but whenever I make egg salad or mashed potatoes with this masher, I congratulate myself all over again for having bought it. Very well-made, nicely balanced, rock-solid. The handle is even ergonomically angled slightly to make it comfortable, and there's a thick plastic strip on one side to help you scrape your egg salad (or mashed potatoes) back into the bowl. The holes seem to be the right size for anything. (You can't borrow mine -- sorry.)
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I ordered this. Just unpackaged to use and it has rust on it. Of course my return has expired. How can I use it for mashing potatoes. I ordered it because Cooks Country voted it the favorite of their testers. I guess the did not know about workmanship. 😢
customer_reviews.author: coolerlady

customer_reviews.title: Durable Masher
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace out old potato masher which broke where the base plate meets the handle. This new masher looks like it can hold up forever, with thick, seamless steel from the handle through the base and back again. The handle is comfortable to hold, and the scraper on the side is a nice addition. The side scraper gets potato stuck under and around it, so it requires careful cleaning. Altogether, I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. van Vuuren

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke in under 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This masher worked great until the handle broke apart. Great functional design but after maybe 20 uses, the handle split apart lengthwise (the two tiny welds inside failed).
customer_reviews.author: R.McG

customer_reviews.title: Handle came apart
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times and the handle came apart.
customer_reviews.author: Merilu

customer_reviews.title: This potato masher was recommended on America's Test Kitchen as the best.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I wanted to mash summer squash for a casserole and I didn't have a potato masher. I always review America's Test Kitchen videos before buying kitchen items. They have always pointed me in the right direction. It is the same with this masher. I used it tonight to mash steamed broccoli for a casserole. I didn't want to get the food processor out and have to clean it afterwards. This masher is excellent; it made quick work of mashing the broccoli to the desired consistency. Comfortable handle, and looks like a red silicone bowler scraper on the side. If you need a potato masher, look no further. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Ponath

customer_reviews.title: and for good reason -- it's an excellent masher
customer_reviews.text: #1 on ATK, and for good reason -- it's an excellent masher. Super sturdy and a contiguous piece of work prevents it from bending or coming apart, like my other mashers have. Plus, the handle is comfortable to grip, especially since the job requires some muscle.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Crowther

customer_reviews.title: Great--just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best masher I've ever used. Solid as a rock, comfortable, and it has a silicone bumper on one side to protect the pan when you hit it to get food off of the masher. It works well and is a useful feature. ATK was correct in recommending this product. NOTE: I paid full retail price and received nothing of value for this review.
customer_reviews.author: A Doctor in Ann Arbor

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to find a sturdy potato masher that will routinely accomplish the mission and not bend. The ZYLISS masher is clearly a leader in the potato mashing field: substantial, yet light weight, and easy to use. Thank-you Amazon for bringing us another high quality, fairly priced product that most brick & mortar stores simply do not carry. BigBill
customer_reviews.author: BigBill

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, highly recommended by ATK
customer_reviews.text: Solid and sturdy. It was less successful crushing frozen peaches for hand pies than a regular masher, though it did work once the fruit broke down. I would expect more success with boiled potatoes. It does come with a special edge for bowl scraping. Easy enough to clean. Wish it came in a different color than red. Red is not my thing and doesn't go with my kitchen decor.
customer_reviews.author: Medieval lady

customer_reviews.title: Great at what it does
customer_reviews.text: Was worried this thing would scratch the bottom of my pan but when using just a little care, it was just fine. It did the job in half the time of my last masher. I was a little worried that it would mash them too much since I like a few small chunks in my taters. To avoid this, just stop early! Very effective, sturdy, ergonomic and nice to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K. Knierim

customer_reviews.title: finally a good masher
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on the test kitchen and got it. It is the best potato masher. Well designed to get into the potatoes and it is easy for my small hands to hold. Good price. Best potato masher I every had. Seems strange in the big picture of life, but when you need to mash a potato and you want it to go fast, a good masher makes a difference:)
customer_reviews.author: The Goose is OUT

customer_reviews.title: A real potato masher
customer_reviews.text: This is what potato masher should be like. None of that squiggly wire stuff. Absolutely happy with this item. Originally, I bought it as an interim product until I found a new potato ricer (my old one broke). Now, after using this for several months, I don't think I need the ricer. This masher leaves no lumps!! It is very strong so you can press as hard as you want, no bending. The handle is long and very comfortable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Masher
customer_reviews.text: Bought it based on an 80k review. It Mash's root vegetables to a very fine puree in less time than it would take to break out your electric mixer. Super sturdy. I always liked older kitchen utensils just because they're cool to look at and it's fun with the history behind them but this is far superior to any of those.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Tall Paul
customer_reviews.text: I guess, it's fine. It does the job. I don't have a lot to say, except it's really long. Not sure why. I was expecting 8 or so inches but it's very tall. If you don't have a lot of space you might want to find a shorter item.
customer_reviews.author: Herb & Anna

customer_reviews.title: well made potato masher
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the same old potato masher for over 40 years, when it finally became unusable, I had to find a new one. Turns out there are a lot of options, but I am quite pleased with the quality, weight and price of this one. Hope it lasts another 40+ years!
customer_reviews.author: Lillibet

customer_reviews.title: I really like my new masher
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new masher. I've only used it a couple of times but really like how well it did the job. My old masher always got things stuck between the S-shapped wire & I couldn't mash small pieces, leaving lumps of food. This masher is comfortable to hold, seems to be well constructed and cleaned up easily.
customer_reviews.author: niteowl

customer_reviews.title: Eagonomic
customer_reviews.text: It feels good in my hand. The stem is curved for practical use. The best of this item no wasted space for potato to mash through. My old masher has a wide rim that only pushed in potato.
customer_reviews.author: A hiker

customer_reviews.title: It's too beautiful to shove in a drawer
customer_reviews.text: So well made. Far beyond our expectations. It's too beautiful to shove in a drawer. My husband and I highly recommend this awesome masher. It's useful, it's very sharp, it is enjoyable to hold. We think it's very special. So far, we've only used it for mashing down cooked pinto beans (making refried beans). I'll let you know what I think, again, after I make some mashed taters!
customer_reviews.author: AmericanWoman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously the best potato masher I’ve ever tried. It really takes less time to mash and I get much smoother potatoes with less effort. I feel a little silly gushing about a potato masher but it is what it is. Get it if you mash once a week like me!
customer_reviews.author: sanot

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well built
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Potato Masher like my Mom had. Found this one instead. Was very pleased when we got it. This will be a family heirloom! Sturdy, mashes all kinds of things very well. Fits well in your hand and I particularly like the scrapper on the side! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooking fun through “Mashing”!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This utensil looks classy and easy to handle. Mashing is fun and easy—helps you to get in groove for a great finished dish. Purchase price reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this potato masher!
customer_reviews.text: I've always used a mixer to mash my potatoes, but no more! My potatoes were fluffy, had no lumps and were delicious. I also used this with great success to brown my sausage. I mashed the sausage as it cooked and it came out exactly right for sausage gravy, quiche and especially my Thanksgiving stuffing. My daughter wants one now! I've purchased several for Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cook your potatos until they are almost mushy.
customer_reviews.text: Generally I like the item but have found that the potatoes need to be well cooked, not firm in any way or you have a lumpy batch of mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Masher.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my 47 year old masher that had a similar design. I looked at several that would have been ok, and were cheaper, but this masher is very well made and fits my husbands hand nicely. I’m not fond of red and would have preferred a black or grey handle.
customer_reviews.author: PlateauGal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! Did a fine job mashing potatoes in my instant pot. I read in a review that they used it to break up hamburger so I tried it - lol a fail for me! The meat just smooshed and would let go of the masher and it took a bit to get the hamburger off but hey I was game to try!
customer_reviews.author: Pageisbusy

customer_reviews.title: MEH
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this thing to mash my potatoes. Too difficult to use. I guess I am not strong enough. I must say that it seems well-made and it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for smashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This makes some of the good mashed potatoes with butter and heavy cream salt and pepper you can’t go wrong good quality strong very happy
customer_reviews.author: Wingnuter (Hardliner,FL,NJ,PA)

customer_reviews.title: Quality merchandise and service.
customer_reviews.text: This potato masher is pleasing to hold. The length of the handle with the rubberized inset cushions the grip, even with the palm of my hand on the top while mashing....no pain. I'm happy with the easy cleanup, just pop it in the dishwasher. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wrj, Owings Mills, MD   This is an addendum to an earlier review of my recent purchase of the All-Clad stainless steel kettle.  I've noticed there are several negative comments about this kettle, such as white flecks in the water, to a filmy discoloration on the interior of the kettle.  After daily use, my interior is as shiny as when I first bought it.  One thing though, I use bottled water.  I find that I don't get like scale on my pots, this kettle, my clothes iron or my drip coffeemaker.  I'm thinking that the reported white flecks in poured water could be that scale flaking off the inside surface. Distilled white vinegar can help eliminate limescale buildup.  As for residue on the outside, I remove my kettle from the stove before frying/sauteeing to avoid free radicals from settling on my kettle. Just a thought.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My favorite brand again!! Zyliss!! I bought this for mashing my fruits for jelly and for mashing avocados. Works perfect on both very happy
customer_reviews.author: bajalori

customer_reviews.title: Mashes every other masher I’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: Don’t want to get to excited about a simple kitchen utensil, lest I seem disingenuous. But this think really does the trick. A consistency just shy of purée was achieved on bananas with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with comfortable design
customer_reviews.text: It is a comfortable design. I use this to mash potatoes and for bananas. It works well and the quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Berrien

customer_reviews.title: How did they improve a potato masher?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had a potato masher like this before! Always just the old fashioned wire ones! This works so much better!! I also love that it has a silicone “fin” on the handle that you can use to scrape down the side of the pot/bowl!
customer_reviews.author: K. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive way to improve my joy of cooking
customer_reviews.text: I make mashed potatoes often so I decided to upgrade the ancient old Calphalon masher I have. For a small cost, this is a much more pleasant experience to use. I am not sure if the end result is any better, but the ease of doing it and cleaning the tool makes the process more enjoyable. I never leave the skin on my mashed, so the skin may cause clogging issues that I am not aware of.
customer_reviews.author: BigBoy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mash
customer_reviews.text: I have put off buying a potato masher for toooo long! This is wonderful. Exceptionally easy to use and very practical. Yukon gold potatoes w onion and garlic and herb cheese mashed to perfection
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest thing since electricity...
customer_reviews.text: After using it for a while, and getting used to it, I decided to edit my review. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch potato masher . . .
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough, sturdy, ergonomic potato masher made by a leading utensil company. Plus, it's stylish and modern. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: D.D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tool
customer_reviews.text: I only use it to make mash potatoes and it works really well. Easy to clean and to hold and mashes really quickly. Very well made and I like the way it comes with one side having a plastic scrapper to get all the mashed potatoes out of the bowl. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty masher
customer_reviews.text: The metal on this masher is heavy duty, it is well designed and super sturdy. It's easy to clean and it's pretty darn handsome!
customer_reviews.author: studio3

customer_reviews.title: This works great
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty heavy and solid so it works well to mash potatoes, bananas etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Best masher ever!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a masher with a flat perforated stainless disk that truly MASHES! Also has very comfortable long handle that works with larger pressure cookers.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyD

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by ATC (and me)
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I bought this because it was recommended by a test kitchen and it does a better job of mashing potatoes than the crooked wire type. The silicone scraper on the side works well for scraping the sides of a pan or bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Another Quality Zyliss Product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Stainless steel portion that contacts the potatoes is one piece all the way up to the handle. Less likely to break, much better quality than other choices. Built-in bowl scraper is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: G$

customer_reviews.title: Not a great masher, but it does mash
customer_reviews.text: I don't love the way this works. It tamps the food down more than it mashes it. I think there is too much surface area. The holes might be good for anyone making spaetzle.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great! Scraper is best removed for cleaning, though.
customer_reviews.text: I will be removing the scraper for cleaning because it provides nooks and crannies where little nasties can incubate, but I am thankful that it can be removed. Four stars on this aspect because I don’t know how it will hold up over repeated remove/replace cycles.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Quite large and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: A bit cumbersome for me. A man's hands would probably be a better fit and comfortable with the weight. Also the stripe looks pink rather than red.
customer_reviews.author: Johnna Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Works good for potatoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother and she usually uses for her beans the holes a little big but it works good for potatoes
customer_reviews.author: Maryam Atabaki

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy but can be hard to handle. A little heavy
customer_reviews.author: Abisgrammy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing masher
customer_reviews.text: Gone are the years of struggling to make the perfect mashed potatoes. This masher transformed my potatoes into the perfect mash with very little effort. No other tools needed.
customer_reviews.author: MsA

customer_reviews.title: Did a perfect job on the potatoes
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about how well this would work on mashing potatoes. I have an old potato masher that my grandmother used and I wanted the same results. This potato masher delivered! I am very happy with this masher and would purhase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Prendergast

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Does What It Should
customer_reviews.text: There's not a whole lot of science behind mashing potatoes or beans. This is reasonably priced, heavy duty, and easily cleans up (I just toss it in the dishwasher).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Must have kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a spoon or fork to smash my potatoes. After seeing this on ATK, I decided to try it. I like the weight of this potato masher and it was comfortable to use. I bought one for my sister and she likes hers as well.
customer_reviews.author: luv2shop

customer_reviews.title: Masher
customer_reviews.text: Works great for potatos, eggs, and beans. It probably works good for other things too. I like that it's round, because it fits the contours of a pan
customer_reviews.author: driver

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made potato masher. I can’t seem to get all the little lumps out though. Works much better for me than the Oxo Good Grips does though. I have better leverage with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: loved that product
customer_reviews.text: usually i hate to mash potatoes its working great with this product
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hihinashvilie

customer_reviews.title: Best potato masher I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several potato mashers over the years but this one is the best so far. Works well mashing black beans for veggie burgers too! Easy to clean after use. Ergonomic handle makes it easy and comfortable to use
customer_reviews.author: JohnP

customer_reviews.title: It's highly rated for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This was amazingly easy to use and extremely effective. I used to have one of the more traditional S-curve mashers. This is superior in every way. I'll be giving some as presents next Christmas. America's Test Kitchen rates this as the best, and it's a well-deserved honor.
customer_reviews.author: John Dewey, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Chunky Potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Had an old Dormeyer hand mixer that had flat blades that did a good job mashing potatoes. New Kitchen Aid hand mixer with wire blades did poorly. Selected this masher based on ATK recommendation. Disappointed with chunks of unmashed potatoes after many smashings.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Grosch

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have having issues using my grandmother's potato masher, son suggested the stainless steel product. It is so quick and easy to use. Also, it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Mold

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Potato Masher
customer_reviews.text: Mashes potatoes quickly and efficiently. The masher is very sturdy with a great handle. It curves in such a way as to be directly above the mashing plate. Varying hole sizes on the plate make sure the potatoes are mashed quickly and easily. Worth every penny, an outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Zenshooter

customer_reviews.title: WORKS REALLY WELL
customer_reviews.text: we ordered one of these because it was well reviewed on America's Test Kitchen/product review. My husband is the potato meister at the house, and he is ecstatic over this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Kimmel

customer_reviews.title: Nice masher!
customer_reviews.text: Rated America's Test Kitchen #1 for a reason, this masher is excellent! I'm a lefty so it probably doesn't work as well ergonomically as it would for someone right handed, but I love it more than any other masher I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepsrkool

customer_reviews.title: Well made masher!
customer_reviews.text: A good solid masher, a little difficult to clean but overall worth it. Love the rubber bumpers along the side so you're not beating your pots to death with it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Strong Potato Masher
customer_reviews.text: I like how this feels in the hand, easy to use and clean. Wish it was not Red. Does not go with my kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Barbara W.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good design, comfortable handle and very sturdy build. Works great, mashed potatoes come out very smooth with no lumps.
customer_reviews.author: gcooper

customer_reviews.title: One piece construction.
customer_reviews.text: I searched forever for a unit that does not have rivits or soldering at the mashing head. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: cmberman

customer_reviews.title: Masher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great masher. What else can you say?
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: potatoe masher
customer_reviews.text: this a nice unit i like the feel of it in my hand while mashing
customer_reviews.author: philip canney

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty masher
customer_reviews.text: I use the to make tomato juice. It so far stands up to the heat.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: American Test Kitchen recommended this masher. My sons didn't like it. The holes were too small for potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: FPlude

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly the type of potato masher I wanted. It may be an old fashioned type ... but it does what I expect from it. It's built solidly and the rubber on the handles feels good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Mills

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This makes mashing potatoes so easy and throw it in dishwasher and it’s as good as new. Really sturdy and easy to hold. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Katarina

customer_reviews.title: Americas Test Kitchen winner
customer_reviews.text: This won Americas Test Kitchen masher Test. The handle is chunky, there are a lot of holes which is why it works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Lola Fanelli

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and ergonomics of the Zyliss. At first I thought maybe the design of holes would be too small; Turns out I like it more since it leaves fewer lumps; gives creamier texture.
customer_reviews.author: D2MC59

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect potato masher I've found. It appears to be good quality, the metal is much thicker than my old masher that broke.
customer_reviews.author: needmorebooks

customer_reviews.title: Strong, high quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty mashing with this device: very high quality and thickness of handle and masher.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Holes too large
customer_reviews.text: Holes are way too large - will leave big chunks rather than smooth-mashed. An immersion blender will work much better. Very heavy so painful to hold
customer_reviews.author: Jenlou

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: The handle design and grip are fantastic and the mashing plate with the holes made quick work of the potatoes...much quicker and easier to use than my old traditional masher.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Jones

customer_reviews.title: Take the leap
customer_reviews.text: Different than my zigzag masher but I am getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Gem in the desert

customer_reviews.title: Hefty enough to be a weapon.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HEAVY. I love it except for the fact it's too big around to fit in a standard silverware drawer. It has to go in in with the pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Good but Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Good masher but I find it quite heavy. Easy to clean, the side scraper is a handy tool.
customer_reviews.author: RIRedd

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great potato masher! Masher potatoes very quickly. Potatoes come out perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: Sara C Floyd

customer_reviews.title: If you need a potato masher, look no further. You've found it.
customer_reviews.text: I read lots of reviews first and am very happy I went with this masher. Works great, balanced in the hand. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal guy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was recommended by American's Test Kitchen and is very sturdy and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This does not tend to bend a bow as much as other I’ve had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Big Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Just my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel, but I don’t think it mashed as well as my old one. I went back to the old one for Thanksgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Whit S

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this potato masher and it is the BEST EVER purchased. Very solid and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a bit heavier, but otherwise it's a good masher. Sturdy and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Grh1

customer_reviews.title: Best for mashing baby food
customer_reviews.text: I love this masher...i use it to mash food for my baby and it mashes to the right texture..
customer_reviews.author: likitha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome masher
customer_reviews.text: We saw this as the highest rated masher on PBS’ America’s Test Kitchen and are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY YOUNG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This replaces an old cheap plastic masher. I cannot believe how easy it is to mash potatoes when you have a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: jamb

customer_reviews.title: Mashes so nice without lumps. Also the longer handle.
customer_reviews.text: I have similar product for 40 years and love it. This is for daughter in law and she loves it. It mashed potatoes to fruit wonderfully. The longer handle saves the knuckles and the edge scraper really comes in handy. My go to for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, mashed potatoes wonderfully. I love the bowl scraping feature and the ergonomic design.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stonebraker

customer_reviews.title: So sturdy and makes very smooth taters
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend. What more can I say?! It makes very smooth and lump-less mashed potatoes. It is sturdy and easy to use. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Strong masher!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Much better than our old plastic ones and the grip is pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

product_meta.title: ZYLISS Potato Masher, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Size:1 CountThe Zyliss Potato Masher is crafted from premium quality stainless steel with soft touch handle for secure grip. The masher features an integrated hanging hook for easy, sleek storage. Integrated silicone bowl scraper removes everything you mash from bowl for less waste. Features small inner holes and larger outer holes for quick mashing without leaving any lumps behind. Dishwasher safe. Focusing on functionality, durability, design, cleanliness and safety, Zyliss has relied upon a heritage of excellence that began in Switzerland over 60 years ago. Building on this time-held tradition, the company has advanced to produce and distribute kitchen equipment that is world-renowned. Zyliss has pioneered the design of more than 200 kitchen essentials, with quality and engineering that cannot be duplicated.
feature_bullets: Crafted from premium quality stainless steel with soft touch handle for secure grip
Features integrated hanging hook for easy storage
Integrated silicone bowl scraper removes everything you mash from bowl for less waste
Features small inner holes and larger outer holes for quick mashing without leaving any lumps behind
